column3:
Note that the build failure in the [macOS 10.12 build](https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/628974602) is because we are still building against the 10.11 SDK, which doesn't contain the required clock functions. Bumping to the 10.14 SDK is being done in #16392.
```bash
randomenv.cpp:240:21: error: unused variable 'ts' [-Werror,-Wunused-variable]
    struct timespec ts = {};
ACK 4738d99: good change, but would this cause issues for backwards compatibility?

~~MacOS 10.12:~~ oh, so this depends on #16392, good to know, added to OP\n```\n/usr/bin/ccache /home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/depends/x86_64-apple-darwin16/native/bin/clang++ -target x86_64-apple-darwin16 -mmacosx-version-min=10.12 --sysroot /home/travis/build/bitcoin/bitcoin/depends/SDKs/MacOSX10.11.sdk -mlinker-version=253.9 -stdlib=libc++ -std=c++11 -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I../src/config

Restarted Travis now that  #16392 is in.

> but would this cause issues for backwards compatibility?

Luckily, that tends to not really an issue for MacOS users.
The macOS builds looked ok, but I've rebased to fix two unrelated Travis errors. Should be all green shortly.
